articles.title: EDUC 641 Assignments
EDUC 641: Introduction to Data Analysis in Education and the Social Sciences

articles.contents: This is the official site for EDUC 641.

articles.title: EDUC 641 Schedule
articles.contents:
EDUC 641
    
    
      
  Syllabus


  Schedule

      
  Assignments


  Course repo

      
  






EDUC 641 Schedule





Week 1
Topic: Introduction to scientific principles and data analysis
Describe goals of course and principles of scientific research
Install statistical software
Readings: TBD
Lecture:
Lecture slides: html file, pdf file
R Tutorial slides: html file


Week 2
Date: TBD
Topic: Summarizing and displaying categorical data
Objectives:
Understand and implement principles of tabular data in R
Describe and summarize quantitative data that are categorical
Create visualizations of quantitative data that are categorical
Write R scripts to conduct these analyses
Readings: TBD
Lecture:
Slides: html file, pdf file
Data: deathpenalty.csv, codebook
R script: R script
Assignment 1:
Due TBD;
html file
cat.csv dataset


Week 3 - 4
Date: TBD
Topic: Examining the relationship between categorical variables
Objectives:
Describe relationships between quantitative data that are categorical
Calculate an index of the strength of the relationship between two categorical variables, the chi-squared ( \(\chi^2\)) statistic
Write R scripts to conduct these analyses
Formulate and describe the purpose of a null hypothesis
Conceptually describe the criteria to make a statistical inference from a sample to a population
Interpret and report the results of a contingency-table analysis and a statistical inference from a chi-squared statistic
Readings: TBD
Lecture:
Slides: html file, pdf file
Data: deathpenalty.csv, codebook
R Script:
Assignment 2:
Due TBD;
html file
cat.csv dataset


Weeks 5 - 7
Date: TBD
Topic: Summarizing and displaying continuous data
Objectives:
Describe the purpose and compute the following measures of central tendency: mean, median and mode
Describe and summarize quantitative data that are continuous
Includes computing the following measures of variability: quartiles, percentiles, inter-quartile range, range, variance and standard deviation
Additionally describe conceptually principles of skewness and kurtosis

Create visualizations of quantitative data that are continuous
Includes constructing stem-and-leaf, box- and violin-plots

Describe special features of a normal distribution
Describe distribution of repeated sample statistics drawn from a population and how this is informative to hypothesis testing
Apply CLT to understand whether mean value of a variable is different than a defined population value (when provided the SD of the variable)
Includes conducting single-sample t-test

Readings: TBD
Lecture slides:
Slides: html file & html file
Data:
R script:
Assignment 3:
Due TBD
html file
cont.csv dataset


Weeks 8 - 10
Topic: Describing relationships between continuous data
Readings: TBD
Lecture slides:
Slides: html file & html file
Data:
R script:
Assignment 4:
Due TBD
html file
cont.csv
Assignment 5:
Due TBD
html file
ah01.csv; ah02.csv









// add bootstrap table styles to pandoc tables
function bootstrapStylePandocTables() {
  $('tr.odd').parent('tbody').parent('table').addClass('table table-condensed');
}
$(document).ready(function () {
  bootstrapStylePandocTables();
});



$(document).ready(function () {
  window.buildTabsets("TOC");
});

$(document).ready(function () {
  $('.tabset-dropdown > .nav-tabs > li').click(function () {
    $(this).parent().toggleClass('nav-tabs-open');
  });
});

  (function () {
    var script = document.createElement("script");
    script.type = "text/javascript";
    script.src  = "https://mathjax.rstudio.com/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML";
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
  })();
